reviews.title: Thank you Villa Orange!
reviews.text: Thank you all at Villa Orange for making my stay so pleasant! The staff was really resourceful in helping me find the things that I needed around the city for my trade show installation. Be sure not to miss EXHIL, a wonderful little restaurant around the corner from the hotel!It will exceed your expectations with its fine cuisine, with the added bonus of having a hip/casual decor!

reviews.title: Doesn't live up to other reviews! Very disappointed!
reviews.text: I recently stayed at Villa Orange after reading many positive reviews. Photos on the website also made it appear a lovely boutique hotel.
On check-in the staff were abrupt, disinterested and rude. There was no attempt at welcoming guests to the hotel and no explanation of facilities.
reviews.title: pleasant stay
Great stay!!
reviews.text: Whilst the bathroom was pleasant, the room itself was tired, shabby and unappealing. The bed had a single duvet and pillow plonked in the middle with greying covers - not what I would expect from a 4 star hotel. In addition, the road outside was very noisy and noise from inside the hotel was also a problem.

reviews.title: Nice Hotel
reviews.text: As a business woman travelling on my own, key criterion for any hotel is that it feels safe and welcoming. Unfortunately Villa Orange did not live up to this.

Villa Orange is a small hotel in a renovated town house, close to the centre of Frankfurt. Not far away from the Zeil shopping district, and not very far from Frankfurt's skyscrapers and the old Opera.
reviews.title: Cosy and quiet business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All rooms are different, but all of them offer high comfort and nicely deisgned interiors. The free wireless Internet is also a wonderful service.
reviews.title: Suitable for short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Villa Orange twice, each for one night while on a layover in Frankfurt. The hotel is situated in a busy residential section. While inside the hotel was very quiet, with nearby construction and the traffic outside - it is definitely not a place for peace and relaxation.
reviews.title: NICE BOUTIQUE HOTEL

reviews.text: The staff while very professional, definitely come across as somewhat cold and hardly welcoming. Even the young ladies attending to the buffet in the morning, were somewhat stand-offish.
reviews.title: Wonderful!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first visit, we stayed in a deluxe room that was quite large, with a huge bathroom and plenty of light. It was comfortable and very clean. Between the heat and the noise, it was the first time I wished they was AC.
reviews.title: Great Choice
Superb weekend value
reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel during the Frankfurt Christmas market. Good location 10 mins walk from town and 2 minutes from bus and tram line. Decided to stay in a superior room which was excellent value for money (I think it's more expensive during the week) - large room with large comfy bed, crisp white linen, modern light wood furniture. Bathroom very clean and spacious with a separate shower and 2 sinks. Huge continental breakfast choice.

reviews.title: Pleasant personality
reviews.text: Very pleasant mid-size hotel about 15 minutes walk from town centre in a nice residential area. Well designed and relaxing interior and definately for the literary minded - books in every room and a well stocked library. Just make sure you book a parking space when travelling by car - they only have five and parking in the surrounding streets is a nightmare! Nearest multi-storey carpark is ten minutes walk away though one is under construction much closer.
